Posts.Content: Jul 23, 2008 11:40PM JStefany12 wrote: I was like you, waited 5 years to get a mammo even when I had a breast discharge.  I'm ashamed to admit that I am an intelligent educated 43 year old, but it took a friend to force me to go for the mammo.  I'm glad he did because I am now scheduled for a ductal excision, quite possibly saving my life.  I try to look at the space between my birth and death as something I have very little control over, but I DO want that space to be as long as possible.. Even if some of the stuff that happens in my life really sucks.  I'd like the chance to correct things, change things, go a different dircetion, do something different.  In other words, the prevention of premature death makes sense to me.  That is how I've been coping with all this.  I was very wrapped up the moment, but it is better at this time to take a more "global", objective view.  Get someone to hold your hand, and press right through.  My thoughts are with you. Stefany
